title: ‚ÄòCheers!‚Äô Series:  YOAH  by Cirquework (Japan)
description:
‚ú© Best of Circus at Adelaide Fringe Weekly Award Winners 2024 & 2025 ‚ú©
‚ú© Outstanding Female Performer Winner at Asian Art Awards of Edinburgh Festival Fringe 2024 ‚ú©

The story themed around ‚ÄòThe Moon at Dawn (Hope)‚Äô. It was about a fantasy story of a girl lost in the underworld where she meets four sinister wizards in mysterious black garbs, who conjure magic with their diabolos, but the girl did not lose hope with the moon's guidance to find the path home.

In this story full of fantasy and adventure, courage and faith help the girl overcome darkness and find her way home. The moon's guidance symbolizes hope, rekindling light in every heart amidst despair.

‚ñ´Ô∏è The running time of each performance is approximately 1 hour without intermission.
‚ñ´Ô∏è Suitable for ages 6 and above.
‚ñ´Ô∏è Members of the audience are strongly advised to arrive punctually.¬† Latecomers and those who leave their seats during the performance will only be admitted and allowed to return to their seats respectively at a suitable break.¬† The presenter reserves the right to refuse admission of latecomers, or determine the time and manner of admission of latecomers.
‚ñ´Ô∏è Performers have been professionally trained.¬† Audience is advised not to imitate their acts.
‚ñ´Ô∏è The programme contains high‚Äëfrequency sounds, strobe lighting and darkened effect.
‚ñ´Ô∏è The presenter reserves the right to change the programme and substitute artists without prior notice
‚ñ´Ô∏è The programme does not represent the views of the Leisure and Cultural Services Department.

title: ‚ÄòCheers!‚Äô Series: Jack and the Beanstalk by Theater Company Hikosen (Japan) (Programme of 'Asia+ Festival' 2025)
description: The classic fairy tale turns into an enchanting puppetry musical! High above the clouds, a treasure-obsessed giant has captured Princess Mary as his latest prize. Luckily, Mary has met Jack, a kind-hearted boy from humble beginnings. Determined to save her, Jack climbs a towering beanstalk grown from magical beans, venturing into the sky and deep into the giant‚Äôs lair. Join Jack on this thrilling rescue adventure!

title: Asia+ Festival 2025: "Strangely Familiar" by The Human Expression (T.H.E) Dance Company
description:
We are always online, connected, yet more alone than ever. In a world saturated with noise and cultural complexity, the simple act of being understood feels increasingly out of reach. Strangely Familiar invites us to slow down and reflect on what it truly means to coexist across cultures in a chaotic world.
Directed by Kuik Swee Boon, founding Artistic Director and main choreographer of Singapore‚Äôs leading T.H.E Dance Company, Strangely Familiar unites a crosscultural team from Singapore, Malaysia, Hong Kong and Macao in a bold attempt to dissolve the boundaries between cultures, identities and realities. By letting go of labels and assumptions, the work opens space for a shared humanity that feels strange but familiar.
Powered by holographic projection and cutting-edge technology, this highly anticipated new creation features the virtual presence of Hong Kong dance artist Zelia ZZ Tan, challenging us to rethink connection, presence, existence across both physical and digital realms.
T.H.E Dance Company is lauded for its distinctive choreographic voice. Its 2011 production As It Fades was hailed as a landmark in Asia‚Äôs contemporary dance scene. Now, in a new commission by Asia+ Festival and the Singapore International Festival of Arts, the company unveils the world premi√®re of Strangely Familiar in Hong Kong ‚Äì a timely and thought-provoking encounter.
presenter: Presented by Leisure and Cultural Services Department

title: Asia+ Festival 2025: Piano Recital by Dang Thai Son
description:
Canadian-Vietnamese pianist Dang Thai Son is the first Asian pianist to claim the top prize in International Chopin Piano Competition. Having performed in over 40 countries in iconic venues such as the Barbican Centre, Musikverein Wien, and Sydney Opera House, Dang has appeared as a soloist with leading orchestras including the BBC Philharmonic, Orchestre de Paris, St. Petersburg Philharmonic, Orchestre Symphonique de Montr√©al and NHK Symphony Orchestra, under the direction of conductors such as Sir Neville Marriner, Vladimir Ashkenazy, and Pinchas Zukerman. His legendary journey from practising piano in a bomb shelter during wartime Vietnam to performing in the most important concert halls worldwide is a testament to music‚Äôs enduring power.
This recital programme features Chopin‚Äôs Scherzo No.2, the work for which he won the first prize at the 10th International Chopin Piano Competition, launching his international career and remaining a hallmark of his recitals ever since. Dang will also perform Faur√©‚Äôs Nocturne and Barcarolle, Ravel‚Äôs Miroirs, and a selection of Chopin‚Äôs nocturnes, waltzes and polonaises.
presenter: Presented by Leisure and Cultural Services Department

title: Duo Recital by Mischa Maisky (Cello) and Lily Maisky (Piano)
EKCC Opening Season: "Song From Far Away || Far Away From Song" by Ivanhoe Chun-ho Lam
description:
As the condolence letters of a surviving brother transform into music, his late brother responds through dance.

At the threshold of reunion, they say farewell, their souls healed.

Ivanhoe Chun-ho LAM, artist-in-residence at the East Kowloon Cultural Centre, continues to deepen his exploration of Simon Stephens' play Song From Far Away after the work-in-progress presentation

So Far, So.... Together with his creative team, they blend monologues, body movement, live choral singing, beatboxing, electronic music, real-time video, and multimedia installations, transforming multiple disciplines into one artistic journey that transcends life and death, offering the audience an experience that is both intimate and communal. Constructed over 365 days and building on the work in progress, a complete version of two interdependent performances (Song From Far Away and Far Away From Song) will be held in two venues, The Turns and The Lab. Both venues are simultaneously connected but distant, where time and space overlap and concur together. A single ticket enables the audience to pass between the realms of life and death.

Two venues, two forms of participation: one is a fluid, immersive environment‚Äîhotels, airports, trains‚Äîwhere one experiences letter writing through sound and music in headphones. Here, audience members are onlookers, passers-by‚Ä¶strangers. The other is a place for spiritual retreat: The body pauses to reach healing through meditation channels. Audience members become participants in an intimate ritual.

Song From Far Away is a journey home: a return to an estranged family and forgotten relationships. The seven letters from the older brother to his deceased younger brother mourn the past while confronting his own failings. The physical body sways between light and shadow, in a kind of requiem, as the sounds of everyday objects transform into laments‚Äîa transmission of contemporary songs of spiritual connection. The multiplicity of senses creates a poetic field as the ignited letters turn into rising smoke.

Far Away From Song becomes the echo of what is absent in the play: The soul sheds the weight of the body, moving in the bardo realm in response to the letters from the older brother. At the end of the journey, their farewell provides for a final reunion.

The cast will be announced in due course, please stay tuned.

title: Hong Kong City Hall Venue Partnership Scheme ‚Äî "Great Violin Concertos": Midori Plays Mendelssohn by Hong Kong Sinfonietta
description:
Conductor	Daniel Raiskin
Violin	Midori
 
Programme
Shostakovich	
Scherzo No 1 in F-sharp minor, Op 1

Mendelssohn	
Violin Concerto in E minor, Op 64

Tchaikovsky	
Symphony No 6 in B minor, Op 74, ‚ÄúPath√©tique‚Äù


Debuting with Zubin Mehta and the New York Philharmonic at the age of 11, triumphing at Tanglewood under Leonard Bernstein after breaking two E strings in a legendary performance at the age of 14, Japanese-American violinist Midori needs no introduction. One of the greatest prodigies the world has ever seen, grown into a truly visionary artist with a marvellous career spanning more than four decades so far, Midori has worked with all top orchestras around the world, and is making a highly anticipated return to Hong Kong to work with Hong Kong Sinfonietta again, this time performing Mendelssohn‚Äôs exquisite Violin Concerto in E minor under the baton of Daniel Raiskin, Designated Chief Conductor and Artistic Director of the Jan√°ƒçek Philharmonic Orchestra. Tchaikovsky‚Äôs monumental Symphony No 6 and a young Shostakovich‚Äôs Scherzo complete what promises to be a breathtaking programme of exquisite masterpieces and extraordinary fireworks.

Following his last sold-out appearance in 2022, Taiwanese-American violin sensation Richard Lin ‚Äì Gold Medallist of the 2018 International Violin Competition of Indianapolis ‚Äì is returning to Hong Kong to collaborate with Hong Kong Sinfonietta and Music Director Emeritus Yip Wing-sie once again, this time presenting an encompassing programme showcasing a selection of best-loved violin works! Expect a dazzling display of virtuosity in Ravel‚Äôs Tzigane and Saint-Sa√´ns‚Äô Introduction & Rondo Capriccioso, and drift into romantic reverie in Dvo≈ô√°k‚Äôs Romance for Violin & Orchestra and Tchaikovsky‚Äôs M√©lodie from Souvenir d‚Äôun Lieu Cher ‚Äì you will fall in love with the violin like never before!

title: Hong Kong Pop Culture Festival 2025:Comic Fun for All‚ÄîThe Magic of Hong Kong Comedy Comics
date:
21/05/2025(Wed)-09/03/2026(Mon) 
Remarks:
Closed on Tue (except public holidays) and the first two days of the Chinese New Year
description:
Taking the perspective of comic artists, this exhibition will open the door to the magical world of comics by showcasing exhibits associated with Hong Kong comedy comics from different periods, including manuscripts, comic books, comic byproducts, art installations and multimedia programmes. Visitors can take photos with comic characters from different periods and gain insights into the inspiration of comic artists. This retrospective of important works that have amused us from the 1950s to the present will bring to life the unique charm of Hong Kong comedy comics, as well as their creative concepts and artistic features.

Jointly presented by the Leisure and Cultural Services Department and the Hong Kong Comics & Animation Federation

Jointly organised by the Hong Kong Heritage Museum and the Hong Kong Comics & Animation Federation

Sponsored by: Cultural and Creative Industries Development Agency (CCIDA)
presenter: Jointly presented by the Leisure and Cultural Services Department and the Hong Kong Comics & Animation Federation

title: Tsuen Wan Town Hall Venue Partnership Scheme : "JITN - Tetsuo Sakurai - Tribute to JACO" by Jazz World & Count-In Music
description:
In the 1970s, bass was often relegated to an accompaniment role. However, talented bassist Jaco Pastorius, with his exceptional playing technique, innovative chords, and tonal developments, transformed the instrument into a leading musical presence. Whether in his fusion jazz band Weather Report or in his personal musical journey, his playing was captivating. Although this prodigy passed away at the young age of 35, he remains etched in the hearts of music fans as one of the greatest bassists of all time.

In this concert, Japanese bass master Tetsuo Sakurai will pay tribute to this American legend by reinterpreting his classic pieces. Sakurai was a core member of the band Casiopea, infusing the group with vibrant bass performances, and later embarked on a solo career that has taken him to over twenty countries. Now, he will come to Hong Kong to honor the genius bassist Jaco Pastorius with his superb artistry.

title: Tsuen Wan Town Hall Venue Partnership Scheme : "JITN-Hiromi‚Äôs Sonicwonder" by Jazz World & Count-In Music
description: Hiromi, a national treasure-level jazz pianist in Japan, has won many heavyweight honors in her music career, including the Grammy Award and the Japan Record Award. Her performance and composition skills have long been highly recognized by the industry. The band she leads also has extraordinary members, including trumpeter Adam O‚ÄôFarrill, who has been recognized by Downbeat magazine twice, as well as the skilled French bassist Hadrien F√©raud and Chicago drummer Gene Coye. The music of this band is very tense, combining jazz, rock, electronic and other musical elements together to form a unique musical expression that is difficult to define with conventional styles.
